item.title: Connecting a remote MongoDB database with R/Shiny
item.description: While making a Shiny App for a lab project (Sensor Overlord), I wanted to create a feature where users could input sensor data into a database, where it could be accessible to other users. I decided to give MongoDB a shot, mostly becuase of the free hosting services available on MongoDB’s website. And it was actually extremely straightforward. There are great resources available online, like the mongolite user manual and the shiny persistent data storage page.

item.title: What Buzzfeed Quizzes have to do with Ratiometric Microscopy
item.description: Science is notoriously poorly communicated. I was recently browsing the DePace Lab Website and it linked me to a fantastic video called “Teaching Matters” by Professor Andrew Murray. My interest in science communication is nothing new, but the video nonetheless made me think twice about how I’m presenting my research. Not only does science need to be communicated to the public (who funds most university research) but it also needs to be better communicated to other scientists, especially those who may benefit from the research but who are in tangential fields with different jargon.
